title: React Accordion Component
description: Collapsible FAQ accordion with smooth animations
code:
import {
  Accordion,
  AccordionContent,
  AccordionItem,
  AccordionTrigger,
} from '@/components/ui/accordion'
import { Card, CardContent, CardHeader, CardTitle } from '@/components/ui/card'

function FAQAccordion() {
  return (
    <Card className="w-full max-w-2xl">
      <CardHeader>
        <CardTitle>Frequently Asked Questions</CardTitle>
      </CardHeader>
      <CardContent>
        <Accordion type="single" collapsible className="w-full">
          <AccordionItem value="item-1">
            <AccordionTrigger>What is React?</AccordionTrigger>
            <AccordionContent>
              React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces,
              particularly single-page applications. It allows developers to
              create reusable UI components and manage the state of their
              applications efficiently.
            </AccordionContent>
          </AccordionItem>
          <AccordionItem value="item-2">
            <AccordionTrigger>How do I get started?</AccordionTrigger>
            <AccordionContent>
              Getting started is easy! You can begin by installing Node.js,
              then use Create React App or Vite to scaffold a new project.
              Follow the official React documentation for step-by-step
              tutorials and guides.
            </AccordionContent>
          </AccordionItem>
          <AccordionItem value="item-3">
            <AccordionTrigger>Is it accessible?</AccordionTrigger>
            <AccordionContent>
              Yes, when built correctly, React applications can be fully
              accessible. It's important to use semantic HTML, ARIA attributes,
              and test your application with screen readers and keyboard
              navigation.
            </AccordionContent>
          </AccordionItem>
          <AccordionItem value="item-4">
            <AccordionTrigger>Can I use it with TypeScript?</AccordionTrigger>
            <AccordionContent>
              Absolutely! React has excellent TypeScript support. TypeScript
              adds static typing to JavaScript, which helps catch errors early
              and improves code quality. Many modern React projects use
              TypeScript as the default.
            </AccordionContent>
          </AccordionItem>
        </Accordion>
      </CardContent>
    </Card>
  )
}

export default FAQAccordion

title: React Search Filter
description: Real-time search and filter through a list of items
code:
import { useState, useMemo } from 'react' import { Input } from '@/components/ui/input' import { Card, CardContent, CardHeader, CardTitle } from '@/components/ui/card' import { Badge } from '@/components/ui/badge' import { MagnifyingGlass } from '@phosphor-icons/react' const ITEMS = [ { id: 1, name: 'React', category: 'Frontend', color: 'blue' }, { id: 2, name: 'Node.js', category: 'Backend', color: 'green' }, { id: 3, name: 'TypeScript', category: 'Language', color: 'blue' }, { id: 4, name: 'PostgreSQL', category: 'Database', color: 'blue' }, { id: 5, name: 'MongoDB', category: 'Database', color: 'green' }, { id: 6, name: 'Express', category: 'Backend', color: 'gray' }, { id: 7, name: 'Vue', category: 'Frontend', color: 'green' }, { id: 8, name: 'Python', category: 'Language', color: 'yellow' }, { id: 9, name: 'Django', category: 'Backend', color: 'green' }, { id: 10, name: 'Angular', category: 'Frontend', color: 'red' }, ] function SearchFilter() { const [searchQuery, setSearchQuery] = useState('') const filteredItems = useMemo(() => { if (!searchQuery.trim()) return ITEMS const query = searchQuery.toLowerCase() return ITEMS.filter( (item) => item.name.toLowerCase().includes(query) || item.category.toLowerCase().includes(query) ) }, [searchQuery]) return ( Search Technologies
setSearchQuery(e.target.value)} className="pl-10" />
Showing {filteredItems.length} of {ITEMS.length} items
{filteredItems.length === 0 ? (

) : (
{filteredItems.map((item) => (

{item.name}

{item.category}

{item.category}
))}
)} ) } export default SearchFilter
